page.title: 02LANDSCAPE & BUILDING
page.content: The area is undulatng chalk downland now farmed,with trees in the valleys. The 3 old villages aree valley settlements with houses of stone, thatch,brick & tile.Broadmayne & Warmwell have stone churches with square towers on the highest ground in the main street.A tributary of the R.Frome rises in Broadmayne.Warmwell's manor house has an angled front elevation & is set in rolling parkland.Poxwell has a 17th century E-shaped manor with small gatehouse. The present owner has installed a helicopter hangar & landing space alongside.Several ancient Droves still exist as well as sign posted bridleways & footpaths.Broadmayne has street lighting in its new housing developments & paved footpaths beside roads are incomplete.
